text:
Hi guys, I got 2 questions. HubSpot offers a 'Blog Content' module when using the design tools. Is it possible to use this field and its functionality in a custom module?
Do you guys have any experience with custom modules and setting them as smart content? A normal HubSpot Rich Text element can be set as 'smart' in the design tools. Can we get the same functionality for custom modules?
Thanks alot!

Ah I see ! <@USUG08WU8> you should be able to wrap the {{ delimeters in `raw` tags to tell HubSpot that your code is not to be evaluated as HubL

```style={% raw %}{{ height: '10%' }}{% endraw %}```

To the best of my knowledge, custom modules don't support smart content
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Custom-Module-SMART-content-not-enabled/td-p/215858>
The local module development has the following documentation:
smart_type: String; determines if the module has been created with 'smart' capability. Can only be set to "NOT_SMART" in a non-global module.
I am not sure if this is the same functionality
Anybody knows a solution for 'Blog content' and 'smart content'?
